intro: Verbesina miahuatlana, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stem and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in dense, spherical clusters. Verbesina miahuatlana is often used in traditional medicine and is also valued for its ornamental appeal.
